title: scorch crashes on writeDicts
body:
Scorch crashes if you have a mapping where the same term is included in both a field where we don't include the term vectors and another field where we do.

When that happens the frequency of the term is 2 but the locs array only contains one item inside the writeDicts function when processing  the term `something`.

Here is the example code and the output when running it (in macOS High Sierra):

```
package main

import (
	"log"

	"github.com/blevesearch/bleve"
	"github.com/blevesearch/bleve/analysis/analyzer/keyword"
	"github.com/blevesearch/bleve/analysis/analyzer/standard"
	"github.com/blevesearch/bleve/index/scorch"
)

func main() {
	mp := bleve.NewIndexMapping()
	keywordMapping := bleve.NewTextFieldMapping()
	keywordMapping.Analyzer = keyword.Name
	keywordMapping.Store = false
	keywordMapping.IncludeTermVectors = false
	textMapping := bleve.NewTextFieldMapping()
	textMapping.Analyzer = standard.Name
	textMapping.Store = false
	docMapping := bleve.NewDocumentStaticMapping()
	docMapping.AddFieldMappingsAt("keyword", keywordMapping)
	docMapping.AddFieldMappingsAt("text", textMapping)
	mp.AddDocumentMapping("doc", docMapping)
	mp.DefaultType = "doc"
	mp.DefaultMapping = docMapping
	mp.DefaultAnalyzer = standard.Name
	mp.DocValuesDynamic = false
	mp.StoreDynamic = false
	mp.IndexDynamic = false

	idx, err := bleve.NewUsing("idx_data", mp, scorch.Name, scorch.Name, nil)
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatalln(err)
	}

	data := map[string]string{
		"keyword": "something",
		"text":    "A sentence that includes something within.",
	}

	idx.Index("id", data)
}
```

The workaround is to include the term vectors for all the fields.
This panic only happens when using scorch, I have tried both moss and boltdb and it works without a problem.
